If the selected icon normally demands a consecutive mouse action, such as inserting a rectangle, then pressing the <f1>Enter</f1> key is not sufficient: in these cases press <f2>Ctrl+Enter</f2>.

On the Customize dialog, select the menu in the <f1>Menu</f1> list and click the <f2>Add</f2> button in the <f3>Menu Content</f3> section of the dialog.
On the Customize dialog, select the menu in the <f1>Menu</f1> list and click the <f2>Add</f2> button in the <f3>Menu Content</f3> section of the dialog.
On the Export dialog, specify a file name for the exported document, then select the desired format in the <f1>File format</f1> list and click the <f2>Export</f2> button.
On the Export dialog, specify a file name for the exported document, then select the desired format in the <f1>File format</f1> list and click the <f2>Export</f2> button.

Sometimes the macro recorder has a failure and understanding LibreOffice internal workings helps to understand how and why the macro recorder sometimes fails.
Sometimes the macro recorder has a failure and understanding LibreOffice internal workings helps to understand how and why the macro recorder sometimes fails.
The EnterMyName macro is not as complicated as it first appears.
The EnterMyName macro is not as complicated as it first appears.
The Gallery (Figure <t0>309</t0>) provides a convenient way to group reusable objects such as graphics and sounds that you can insert into your documents.
The Gallery (Figure <t0>309</t0>) provides a convenient way to group reusable objects such as graphics and sounds that you can insert into your documents.
The example shows some of LibreOffice’s predefined styles.
The example shows some of LibreOffice’s predefined styles.
The most used application commands were put together in the Styles, Sheets, and Slide menus, respectively.
The most used application commands were put together in the Styles, Sheets, and Slide menus, respectively.

To change the way that LibreOffice stores the hyperlinks in your file, select <f0>Tools > Options > Load/Save > General</f0> and choose if you want URLs saved relatively when referencing the <f1>File System</f1>, or the <f2>Internet</f2>, or both.

To change the way that LibreOffice stores the hyperlinks in your file, select <f0>Tools > Options > Load/Save > General</f0> and choose if you want URLs saved relatively when referencing the <f1>File System</f1>, or the <f2>Internet</f2>, or both.

To have the shortcut key assignment available only with one component (for example, Writer), select that component’s name in the upper right corner of the page; otherwise select <f0>LibreOffice</f0> to make it available to every component.

To have the shortcut key assignment available only with one component (for example, Writer), select that component’s name in the upper right corner of the page; otherwise select <f0>LibreOffice</f0> to make it available to every component.
Use the <f1>Down Arrow</f1> and <f2>Right Arrow</f2> to select the desired toolbar icon and press <f3>Ctrl+Enter</f3>.
Use the <f1>Down Arrow</f1> and <f2>Right Arrow</f2> to select the desired toolbar icon and press <f3>Ctrl+Enter</f3>.

You may get better results by passing scanned material into a graphics program and cleaning it up there before inserting the resulting image into LibreOffice.
